data.title: Studio 5000 - Code 16#031b: Rack Connection Refused
data.meta_description:
Hello all,

I am trying to implement an RFID reader into our process and I am running into an issue.

I have a bus that can handle 2 RFID read/write heads...
data.text:
Hello all,

I am trying to implement an RFID reader into our process and I am running into an issue.

I have a bus that can handle 2 RFID read/write heads. The bus has Ethernet capability.

Each station will have one RFID read/write head.

The issue comes when I try to add them to the IO tree:

The RFID bus is what connects to the switch in the control panel and the switch is on our local network.

Adding the bus to the first processor's IO tree was not a problem. It was communicating as intended. I could read and write with the head.

When I tried to add the bus to the second processor's IO tree, I was met with error code 16#031b: Rack Connection Refused.

Since each head had its own channel and associated tags in the EDS file, I assumed that I would be able to use a channel for each press.

Am I wrong for thinking this?

Anyone else run into this issue before?

Any help would be greatly appreciated,

Thanks!
